{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3534702,"name":"Angel","username":"Krypto_Rex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/krypto_rex/{size}/225308_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T20:50:51.559Z","cooked":"

We recently got our bot up and running but noticed that one of our new Krakens blinks simultaneously red and orange.

Blinking Video

The CTRE documentation does not have a reference to this pattern of blinking. However, when we pull up the motor in Phoenix Tuner, the motor says it is blinking simultaneously orange.

Otherwise, the motor seems to be working fine and we have no other issues with it. I was wondering if anyone else has run into this issue or if its just a manufacturing/software bug.

Your link is restricted, so I can’t see the video. If I had an extra motor I would swap it in as an abundance of caution. If you don’t, I think trusting that Phoenix Tuner says it is fine would be good enough for my team.

Just fixed the video link. Im not too worried about it now since it is on our proto-bot, but I do think I may want to return it for a properly working one.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T21:02:07.663Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492481,"topic_slug":"kraken-x60-undocumented-status-light","display_username":"Angel","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":57796,"username":"philip124816","name":"Philip","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/b782af/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51896,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Angel | Mentor | Alumni | Volunteer | FUN"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x60-undocumented-status-light/492481/3","custom_user_title":"Angel | Mentor | Alumni | Volunteer | FUN","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3534722,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T21:18:32.212Z","cooked":"

It looks like one of the green LEDs is dead or damaged; you can use Self Test in Tuner X to confirm that the actual blink code is simultaneous orange. The motor should still work fine, but if you want to see if you can get it repaired or replaced, you can send an email to support@ctr-electronics.com.

Yeah self test confirmed the blink code is simultaneous orange. The motor seems to be working normally so Ill see what the team wants to do.
